rComments: Professor Karlis gets a lot more hate than he deserves. He is kind and very passionate about the topic that he is teaching. His expectations are clear and his lectures are given at a slow and easy pace. If you do the readings and watch the lectures you will do fine.
Not a good professor. Quiz questions are very stupid, he'll ask you about direct quotes from the books. You need to attend lectures even though they're extremely boring,

Lectures are mandatory since they aren't recorded and the midterm and exams are mainly about his lectures. 20 questions in 12 mins for biweekly quizzes and lots of readings assigned from his textbooks, all in all I mean it is what it is you'll be fine.

Prof Karlis basically taught me how to control F at high speed. He is a nice guy. But his method of testing students is a bit weirdfifty multiple-choice questions in 30 minutes for the midterm + exam. If you're good with the control F button, this class is for you. But if you actually want to learn and apply what you've learned, stay away.
Professor Karlis needs to accommodates students better for online learning. Did not have the most pleasant experience in this class.

Great guy but the lectures are just him repeating himself for hours and then we get assigned 50 pages of textbook to read a week that just repeats exactly what he says in class. Easy course for a credit but if you're looking for something interesting: AVOID HIM

Dr. Karlis is a great prof. I can understand why some people say he isn't great at teaching online. Once school goes back in person, TAKE HIS COURSE! He is such a great prof and yes, he wrote the textbook, but it is the ONLY textbook I kept in my three years of university so far. I am actually pursuing a minor is leisure studies because of Karlis!

Alright. Just no. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. maybe he is different in person but online brutal. His tests are way too hard for the course and I fall asleep in every lecture I attended. So boring. Nice guy but he doesn't know how to teach online. Suprised I even passed this course. the tests are so specific and you have 500 pages to read of both books.

Karlis was a very nice man, but his lectures were so dry. He moved very slowly and most of the learning was through a textbook. Not my kind of class but I can see how some might enjoy it. His exam and midterm questions are very stupid though. He will ask if a direct quote is from a specific textbook, while it could be from another one.
AVOID if you want to get a good mark! He is a VERY tough marker. Take this class if you want your mark to drop.

he is a sweetie, so nice and so passionate about the subject. BUT no online material provided, so in class be prepared to type. He speaks slowly and repeats so its easy get all the info. there are 5 mini-tests on chapter on the textbook. The tests are easy just make sure to read. the midterm and final were not super difficult once again just study.
Avoid at all costs if you want a really good mark especially for an elective.
he has a boring class so boring you will wonder as if you even want to be in uni

He poorly explains the project and doesn't give feedback on the project either. Also, he doesn't use ppt so get ready to type literally everything. He assigns heavy readings and the midterm had tricky questions. The project is the final exam but he's a tough marker. Definitely not an easy elective.

George might be nice but hes boring as hell. Ill take the easy credit but it feels well earned after sitting though him repeating the dry meaningless material. Hope you enjoy the lectures more than I did.
Best professor I have ever had.

AWESOME Prof!! Literally my favorite. 5 quizzes, no big assignments or big exams. Just small multiple choice quizzes. And if everyone does bad on a certain amount of questions, he gives you bonus points. He literally gave us 6 points so if you got 14/20 then you now have 20/20. THE best

NEED TO ATTEND. He doesn't even post the SYLLABUS online. He wrote the textbook, so good luck finding other sources to read the necessary material. You need to attend lectures and pay attention, as well as read the book. I have never read so much of a textbook, cause he makes the quizzes based solely on textbook material, and the exams on lectures.

Professor Karlis is hands down the most caring, genuine, and helpful professor you'll ever meet. He properly convey's his material. Show up, pay attention and you'll do well in his class. Can't say enough nice things about him.
Excellent professor. Cares about his students. His expectations are very clear so you know whats expected from you. I would take other courses with him in a flash.

Professor Karlis loves it. He loves the field of leisure studies. He does not use technology whatsoever. Going to class is a must! The course is a midterm and a project + presentation. He tells you what to study for the midterm which is nice! Lectures are very long and drag on. I would take another of his classes! Nice guy!

TBH  sweetest professor ever, really cares for his students, LSR is such a boring class tbh i guessed my way through it and still got within the 80s. As a teacher he is one of my favorite because he is so caring, the class tho is incredibly boring

Prof Karlis keeps it old school, and he does not post anything online.  Having said that, he is engaging, respecful, and gives a clear outline on what he expects from the class. What a great professor, and I would recommend him to any student who wants a B or higher.  His midterms and texts can be completed in under 20 minutes.

Literally copy and pastes exam questions from his book and turns them into true or false. Re-read the material until you know it word for word. Other than that, he's an alright prof. Would probably benefit students if he used more stimulating visual such as powerpoint.

Took LSR1100 and it was the most boring course I've ever taken. Karlis just goes on and on about useless facts. He explains every detail, and moves through the material very slowly. Study hard for the exam, because it was a lot of dates, names and theories.

Awesome guy, great prof! Very interested in what he's teaching and honestly wants his students to do well. Gives awesome reviews before every exam so you know just what to study. Exams are very fair, no surprises. Highly recommend.

Very easy prof and a very good guy, takes time to make him self available outside of class for any extra questions, he repeats things in order for people to understand it more clearly. Barely need to study, his teaching style allows you to know everything when time for midterms come! Persuasive about his subject, modest about writing the textbook
He repeats too many times, but if you are a slow writer it can be great. He enjoys what he does and knows a lot.

You can call him Mr.3peat, because he repeats everything 3 times, even if it is 2 words. However, that aside, he does love his material, and as stated by another reviewer has an "infectious love of knowledge" Boring material, 7-10 on a monday night was brutal. If you actually read the material for tests/quizzes you will do well :P
-very professional
The most annoying class I have ever taken. I was boring beyond belief. Georgy was into it, but no one else was.

Hot Greek God of a Professor!  I would imagine him competing in the ancient Olympics wielding nothing but his javelin  I loved the Prof, his texbook and the course content.  Nice teeth, nice smile and an infectious love of knowledge.
Awesome guy... loves to teach... wants everyone in his classes to do well
Good guy all around. Tells you almost everything on the exams because he wants you to do well.
Best teacher ever, can be dry, but repeats everything, class discussions, best teacher ever

Karlis is not only a superb Prof he also takes the time for his students and offers them opportunities such as being a Teaching Assistant and will go the extra mile to assist students in being accepted to Grad school!  Thanks to Karlis I have an M.A. and a great full time job teaching phys. ed.!!!
Excellent Prof.  Very helpful and understanding.  As long as you take notes, you'll pass.  If you miss a bunch of classes, it might be hard to catch up.  Love the exams.

I had him for LSR 1105,2181,& 4110. The most popular prof. in the Leisure Studies department; he has great relationship with his students, expecially 3rd/4th yr LSR students. He's very easy too, no many profs can beat the couses he teaches.
Great professor. He's a class act. Tells class exactly what to study for and focus on. Wants everybody to do well. Take the class, definite A+.
great prof, really easy course, the class gets kinda slow but he wants everyone to get an A+, tells exactly what to study for each exams.
dry, often off topic, slow tempo of the class
the best prof ever. helpful, kind... there's nothing bad to say about him
pretty decent grades, easy course if u study a bit
EASIEST PROF EVER (and that's coming from a leisurestudies student)!Goodguyw/ego
pretty nice guy
great prof, very fair
Very high on himself and boring too.
